comments.text:
in a movie where actresses do their own fight scenes instead of stunts, is 
really interesting show possible ways to kick it! This scene almost had the 
same problem as Charlie's Angels 2! The weapon Gogo is quite unique, it 
worked well! I like the flip of Beatrix on 00:42, the fall in 1:18 Gogo did 
not work (it should be more realistic, because at that time you would like 
to give it a good few slaps), censorship in the death of Gogo was bad, when 
the camera again focus her face her hair was very different which made 
​​him lose all legitimacy in the scene!﻿

comments.author: Luke47895

comments.text:
What is probably the most confusing thing about Kill Bill movies for me is 
why would Tarantino make such a great buildup for this amazing sword, but 
then the Bride would end up killing:
- Gogo with a chair leg (get's disarmed quickly)
- Vernita with a knife (didn't bring the sword at all for some reason)
- Emme with a hand-to-hand skills and someone else's sword
- (Budd is dead already when she gets back)
- And finally Bill himself with hand-to-hand skills (get's disarmed quickly)

After all she only killed a couple extras and Cottonmouth with that sword. 
If you ask me, she didn't need the thing after all.﻿

comments.author: Joey Matheny

comments.text:
This scene might won for Best Fight Category in MTV Movie Awards 2004, but 
I bet it's harder for actress Chiaki Kuriyama to play Gogo who must learn 
how to be able to swing/fling and fight using the soft-but-deadly weapon, 
Meteor Hammer, than Uma as The Bride with katana...
And I think, this The Bride vs Gogo fight scene gives more thrill than The 
Bride vs Gogo's mistress, O-Ren Ishii...﻿

comments.text:
What Gogo is using is a real weapon. It's called a meteor hammer. It comes 
from ancient China. Even when Tarantino is supposed to be thinking about 
Kurosawa, he keeps going back to those old Hong Kong kung fu movies, I 
guess.﻿

comments.text:
Meteor Hammer is seldom used in films (that's why I love this scene) N the 
specialty is her weapon, Chain Meteor Hammer, really match her 
personalities: -It's categorized as a soft weapon, seems not deadly n so 
easy to beat=She seems to be just an ordinary high school girl -When used 
to attack, it is deadlier than a katana coz it's multifunctional=Gogo is so 
skillful in using her weapon, so The Bride has to be creative to beat her, 
esp after Gogo successfully dump her katana
